lines.text: [last lines]
Well, Denham, the airplanes got him.
Oh no, it wasn't the airplanes. It was beauty killed the beast.
[Captain translates Native Chief's comments on Ann Darrow]
He says, "Look at the golden woman."
Yeah, blondes are scarce around here.
[Kong has been knocked out by gas bombs]
Why, the whole world will pay to see this.
No chains will ever hold that.
Kong, the Eighth Wonder of the World.
Don't be alarmed, ladies and gentlemen. Those chains are made of chrome steel.
Do you always take the pictures yourself?

Ever since a trip I made to Africa. I'd have got a swell picture of a charging rhino, but the cameraman got scared. The darn fool, I was right there with a rifle! Seems he didn't trust me to get the rhino before it got him. I haven't fooled with a cameraman since; I do it myself.
[first lines]
Say, is this the moving picture ship?
The Venture? Yeah. Are you going on this crazy voyage?
What's crazy about it?

[warning Jack about women]
Some big, hardboiled egg gets a look at a pretty face and bang, he cracks up and goes sappy!

[to Ann]
Hey... I guess I love you.

[protesting the agent's lack of confidence in the safety of Denham's voyage]
You act as if I've never brought anybody back alive! Look at the Captain and first mate - - they've gone on several of my last missions, and they don't look any the worse for wear.

[sarcastically, in wary half-hearted agreement with Denham's assertions]
Yeah - - we're healthy!
Listen, there are dozens of girls in this town tonight that are in more danger than they'll ever see with me.
Yeah, but they know that kind of danger.

[observing the natives dancing]
Holy mackerel! What a show!
Listen - I'm going out and make the greatest picture in the world. Something that nobody's ever seen or heard of. They'll have to think up a lot of new adjectives when I come back.
It's money and adventure and fame. It's the thrill of a lifetime and a long sea voyage that starts at six o'clock tomorrow morning.
I thought you didn't like woman?
Yeah, but you're not woman.
I can't sit so close to the screen; it hurts my eyes.
This isn't a moving picture, ma'am.
What? But Mr. Denham makes those pictures with those darling lions and tigers and things.
This is more in the nature of a personal appearance, ma'am.
Well I never... thought I was gonna see something.
Hey, wouldja' look at that...
Natives running through the village.
Yeah... looks like the night before election.
Malem me pakeno!

And now, ladies and gentlemen, before I tell you any more, I'm going to show you the greatest thing your eyes have ever beheld. He was a king and a god in the world he knew, but now he comes to civilization merely a captive - a show to gratify your curiosity. Ladies and gentlemen, look at Kong, the Eighth Wonder of the World.
Say, what is it, anyhow?
I hear it's a kind of a gorilla.
Gee - ain't we got enough of them in New York?

[to Ann]
Say... I think I love you.

[just before he instructs Ann on how to act in front of the camera]
I see you've put on the "Beauty and the Beast" costume!
Uh, huh... it's the prettiest!
What do you call that thing?
Something from the dinosaur family.
Dinosaur, eh?
Yes, Jack; a prehistoric beast.
Don't you think the skipper's a sweet old lamb?
Ha ha ha! I'd hate to have him hear me say that!
Holy mackrel, do you think I want to take a woman along?
Then why?
Because the public - bless 'em - must have a pretty face.

[calling from the top of the wall]
Hey, look out, it's Kong! Kong's comin'!

[Kong frantically shakes his chains]
Hey, wait a minute, wait a minute; he thinks you're attacking the girl...
Aw, let him roar, it's a swell picture...
Wait a minute, what about Kong?
Well, what about him?
We can here to get a moving picture, and we've found something worth more than all the movies in the world!

[incredulous]
What?
We've got those gas bombs. If we can capture him alive...
Why, you're crazy. Besides that, he's on a cliff where a whole army couldn't get at him.
Yeah, if he stays there...
[looks at Ann]
but we've got something he wants.

[holds Ann]
Yeah. Something he won't get again.
I'm gonna go out and find a girl for my picture - even if I hafta' *marry* one.
Whaddaya think of that wall, Skipper?
Colossal; might almost be Egyptian.
Yeah, but what's on the other side of that wall; that's what I wanna find out.
Say, what's Denham got, anyway?

[in doubtful pre-disgust]
Well, it better be good after all this ballyhoo!

[offering native jewelry]
Skipper, look what I find.
A native bracelet!
Crazy black man been here.

[seeing the island for the first time]
Well, Skipper, there she is... Skull Mountain, the wall... everything just like on my funny little map.

[talking to Jack across the ravine]
Why, you wouldn't follow that beast alone?
Someone's got to stay on his trail while it's hot!

[after discovering a huge footprint of Kong]
Keep those guns cocked.
He's tellin' us.
I'd hate to have that thing wrapped around me.
Serve out the rifles! Man the boats!
And you expect to photograph it?
If it's there, you bet I'll photograph it!
Suppose it doesn't like having its picture taken?
Well, now you know why I brought along those cases of gas bombs
Throw your arms across your eyes and scream, Ann. Scream for your life!
There's one thing we haven't thought of...
What?
Airplanes. If he should put Ann down, and they can fly close enough to pick him off without hitting her...
You're right! Planes! Call the field!

[chasing after sailor]
Hey, come back with those bombs, you s...

[talking into a police call box]
Send the riot squad and ambulances! Kong has escaped!

[the witch doctor has complained to the Chief]
What's that?
Must be the Witch Doctor. He says the ceremony is spoiled because we've seen it.
Well, calm the old boy down! What's the word for friend?
Bala.

[moving toward the Chief, arms out and palms up]
Bala; bala.
Punya!

[after finding a native bracelet on the deck of the ship]
All hand on deck! Everybody on deck! Everybody on deck! All hand on deck! Everybody on deck! Everybody on deck!
